intro: Cicerbita orbelica, commonly known as the Orbeli's cicerbita, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in umbels. The plant has palmate leaves that are deeply lobed, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in rocky or dry soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and sometimes endangered species.
